Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class HighlightedLine

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HighlightedLine
public final class HighlightedLine extends Object
Encapsulates information about a line that is passed to a Highlighter. Several helper methods are provided that can be called by the highlighter to obtain information about the line.
Since:
3.0
See Also:
Highlighter.paint(java.awt.Graphics2D, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HighlightedLine)

  • Method Details

    • editor

      public JSourceCodeEditor editor()
      Returns the editor that is being painted.
      Returns:
      the editor that is calling the highlighter

    • line

      public int line()
      Returns the 0-based line index of the line being painted.
      Returns:
      the line index

    • text

      public String text()
      Returns the text of line being painted.
      Returns:
      the text of the highlight line

    • text

      public String text​(int offset, int length)
      Returns a substring of the line text.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset, relative to the start of the line
      length - the maximum length of the text to return
      Returns:
      the specified substring of the highlight line

    • text

      public Segment text​(int offset, int length, Segment segment)
      Returns a substring of the line text, storing it within a Segment. This is more efficient than storing it in a String.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset, relative to the start of the line
      length - the maximum length of the text to return
      segment - the segment to store text in; may be null
      Returns:
      a segment storing the specified substring of the highlight line

    • startOffset

      public int startOffset()
      Returns the document offset at which the line begins.
      Returns:
      the character index of the line start

    • endOffset

      public int endOffset()
      Returns the document offset at which the line ends.
      Returns:
      the character index of the line end

    • offset

      public int offset​(int x)
      Returns the offset from the start of the line for an X-coordinate, or -1 if the X-coordinate does not fall within the line.
      Parameters:
      x - the X-coordinate
      Returns:
      the offset of the X-coordinate, in characters, from the start of the line, or -1

    • x

      public int x​(int offset)
      Returns the X-coordinate of the start of the character at the specified offset from the start of the line being highlighted.
      Parameters:
      offset - the character offset from the start of the highlighted line
      Returns:
      the X-coordinate of the specified character

    • y

      public int y()
      Returns the Y-coordinate at which the line is being painted.
      Returns:
      the Y origin

    • textRectangle

      public Rectangle textRectangle​(int offset, int length)
      Returns a rectangle describing the bounds of the substring of the highlighted line that begins at offset and extends for length characters.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset of the first character to include, counted from the start of the line
      length - the number of characters after the first to include
      Returns:
      a rectangle for the bounds of the specified text segment

    • lineHeight

      public int lineHeight()
      Returns the height of the line being highlighted.
      Returns:
      the line height, including any leading

    • ascent

      public int ascent()
      Returns the offset from the Y-coordinate to the text baseline.
      Returns:
      the distance to the text baseline

    • font

      public Font font()
      Returns the base font used by the editor.
      Returns:
      the editor font

    • fontMetrics

      public FontMetrics fontMetrics()
      Returns the font metrics for the base font used by the editor.
      Returns:
      the editor font metrics

    • viewWidth

      public int viewWidth()
      Returns the width of the document view that is painting the line.
      Returns:
      the view width

    • viewHeight

      public int viewHeight()
      Returns the height of the document view that is painting the line.
      Returns:
      the view height

    • tokenList

      public Token tokenList()
      Returns the head of the token list for the line that is being painted. This may be null if there is no tokenizer set or when painting lines that fall outside of the document. The token list must not be modified.
      Returns:
      the token list, or null
